channel.title: The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast
channel.description: Get the latest news and go behind-the-scenes of the world's #1 family audio drama, 'Adventures in Odyssey'! In 'The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast', you'll hear fun stories straight from the show's actors -- and 'Adventures in Odyssey' producers regularly answer fan questions submitted at AdventuresinOdyssey.com/Podcast. New editions available every other Wednesday. Subscribe now to get each new edition right when it releases!
channel.itunes:summary: Get the latest news and go behind-the-scenes of the world's #1 family audio drama, 'Adventures in Odyssey'! In 'The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast', you'll hear fun stories straight from the show's actors -- and 'Adventures in Odyssey' producers regularly answer fan questions submitted at AdventuresinOdyssey.com/Podcast. New editions available every other Wednesday. Subscribe now to get each new edition right when it releases!
channel.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

image.title: The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast

item.title: Why Adventures in Odyssey Is Becoming a Movie
item.itunes:title: Why Adventures in Odyssey Is Becoming a Movie
item.description: Focus on the Family Vice President Jennifer Arthur explains what her movie producer job actually looks like, what she brought from her years at Amazon, and why Focus chose to create an animated film. Hear more about the realities of moviemaking, the ministry behind the project, and what will make this movie different from anything else.
item.content:encoded: Focus on the Family Vice President Jennifer Arthur explains what her movie producer job actually looks like, what she brought from her years at Amazon, and why Focus chose to create an animated film. Hear more about the realities of moviemaking, the ministry behind the project, and what will make this movie different from anything else.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Finding the Edge: Shona on Jules’s Journey
item.itunes:title: Finding the Edge: Shona on Jules’s Journey
item.description: Jules Kendall’s journey reaches a powerful crossroads in “Crossing the Line” and “On the Edge.” In this spoiler-filled conversation, Shona Rodman talks about portraying anger, desperation, fear, and faith in a huge step in Jules’s journey.
item.content:encoded: Jules Kendall’s journey reaches a powerful crossroads in “Crossing the Line” and “On the Edge.” In this spoiler-filled conversation, Shona Rodman talks about portraying anger, desperation, fear, and faith in a huge step in Jules’s journey.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Shaping Jules’s Salvation with Sound
item.itunes:title: Shaping Jules’s Salvation with Sound
item.description: Sound designers Zach Schneider and Luke Guenot unpack how car sounds, smoke bombs, voices on the wind, and even silence itself shaped Jules Kendall’s journey in “Crossing the Line” and “On the Edge.” Plus, hear a preview of the upcoming adventure, “Now Hiring.”
item.content:encoded: Sound designers Zach Schneider and Luke Guenot unpack how car sounds, smoke bombs, voices on the wind, and even silence itself shaped Jules Kendall’s journey in “Crossing the Line” and “On the Edge.” Plus, hear a preview of the upcoming adventure, “Now Hiring.”
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: When is the Chairman Coming Back? What’s Next After CDs?
item.itunes:title: When is the Chairman Coming Back? What’s Next After CDs?
item.description:
Writer/director Kathy Buchanan, art director Evan David, co-creator Phil Lollar, showrunner Marshal Younger, and line producer Nathan Hoobler tackle listener questions, including: Why did so many kid characters change when Whit’s voice changed? Did the wind really speak to Jules in “On the Edge?” How short is Jay Smouse? And will the Odyssey movie be available on the Club? Plus, don’t miss the reveal of the fan-voted title for Album 81.

  • See what's Coming Soon on the Club, including a new episode on January 15!
  • Listen to Album 79: Eleventh Hour or Album 80: Rewritten in the Club.
  • Check out Album 79 on CD or download.
item.content:encoded:
Writer/director Kathy Buchanan, art director Evan David, co-creator Phil Lollar, showrunner Marshal Younger, and line producer Nathan Hoobler tackle listener questions, including: Why did so many kid characters change when Whit’s voice changed? Did the wind really speak to Jules in “On the Edge?” How short is Jay Smouse? And will the Odyssey movie be available on the Club? Plus, don’t miss the reveal of the fan-voted title for Album 81.

  • See what's Coming Soon on the Club, including a new episode on January 15!
  • Listen to Album 79: Eleventh Hour or Album 80: Rewritten in the Club.
  • Check out Album 79 on CD or download.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

psc:chapter.title: Release date of the AIO movie
Will the movie be on the Club?
When will the Chairman come back?
Are Jason and Jillian going to get together?
What is planned for future albums after CDs?

item.title: FREE EPISODE: “Value of a Buck, Part 1”
item.itunes:title: FREE EPISODE: “Value of a Buck, Part 1”
item.description: In this first episode of Album 80: “Rewritten,” Buck visits Odyssey and Jules braces to tell him her life-changing news. Meanwhile, a nursing-home “ministry” has an unsettling similarity to a dark detail from Buck’s past. (Theme: Choosing the right path) Plus: Vote on the title of Album 81
item.content:encoded: In this first episode of Album 80: “Rewritten,” Buck visits Odyssey and Jules braces to tell him her life-changing news. Meanwhile, a nursing-home “ministry” has an unsettling similarity to a dark detail from Buck’s past. (Theme: Choosing the right path) Plus: Vote on the title of Album 81
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Top 10 Episode Countdown
item.itunes:title: Top 10 Episode Countdown
item.description: Five hundred podcasts, thirty-eight years of Adventures in Odyssey, and one epic countdown! Bob and Jesse celebrate by revealing the ten most-listened-to episodes in the Club, complete with never-before-heard audio and behind-the-scenes stories from the cast and crew.
item.content:encoded: Five hundred podcasts, thirty-eight years of Adventures in Odyssey, and one epic countdown! Bob and Jesse celebrate by revealing the ten most-listened-to episodes in the Club, complete with never-before-heard audio and behind-the-scenes stories from the cast and crew.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Visit to the Texas State Fair in Young Whit and the Shell Game
item.itunes:title: Visit to the Texas State Fair in Young Whit and the Shell Game
item.description: Executive producer and author Dave Arnold previews Young Whit and the Shell Game, the sixth book in the Young Whit series. Hear how this stand-alone adventure expands Whit’s world, connects to lessons he’ll carry into adulthood, and offers a glimpse of what’s ahead for the series. Plus: A preview of “Value of a Buck, Part 1”
item.content:encoded: Executive producer and author Dave Arnold previews Young Whit and the Shell Game, the sixth book in the Young Whit series. Hear how this stand-alone adventure expands Whit’s world, connects to lessons he’ll carry into adulthood, and offers a glimpse of what’s ahead for the series. Plus: A preview of “Value of a Buck, Part 1”
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Solving the Final Mystery: The Legacy of the Last Chance Detectives
item.itunes:title: Solving the Final Mystery: The Legacy of the Last Chance Detectives
item.description: The Last Chance Detectives have been solving mysteries for more than thirty years—on screen, on audio, and now in books. As Book 8: The Curse of Calamity Wells releases, hear from creator and author Bob Vernon and editor Thomas Jeffries about bringing the beloved franchise full circle. Discover how the series began, what kept it alive through decades and formats, and how the long-awaited mystery of Mike Fowler’s father is finally resolved.
item.content:encoded: The Last Chance Detectives have been solving mysteries for more than thirty years—on screen, on audio, and now in books. As Book 8: The Curse of Calamity Wells releases, hear from creator and author Bob Vernon and editor Thomas Jeffries about bringing the beloved franchise full circle. Discover how the series began, what kept it alive through decades and formats, and how the long-awaited mystery of Mike Fowler’s father is finally resolved.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Into the Spotlight: Shining Light on Jonathan’s Story
item.itunes:title: Into the Spotlight: Shining Light on Jonathan’s Story
item.description: Writer Bob Smithouser, collaborator Abigail Geiger, and sound designer Nathan Jones take listeners “Out of the Spotlight” and explain why the name turned out to be such an appropriate title for both Jonathan’s journey and the production itself.
item.content:encoded: Writer Bob Smithouser, collaborator Abigail Geiger, and sound designer Nathan Jones take listeners “Out of the Spotlight” and explain why the name turned out to be such an appropriate title for both Jonathan’s journey and the production itself.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Wayback Wednesday: Say hello to Lucy… again.
item.itunes:title: Wayback Wednesday: Say hello to Lucy… again.
item.description:
Genni Long (Lucy Cunningham-Schultz) reflects on more than 70 episodes, falling in love with Jack Davis (Donald Long), and what life has looked like since her last Odyssey appearance.

If you enjoyed listening to The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast, please give us your feedback.
item.content:encoded:
Genni Long (Lucy Cunningham-Schultz) reflects on more than 70 episodes, falling in love with Jack Davis (Donald Long), and what life has looked like since her last Odyssey appearance.

If you enjoyed listening to The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast, please give us your feedback.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Chess Moves with Dr. Blackgaard
item.itunes:title: Chess Moves with Dr. Blackgaard
item.description:
Phil Lollar dishes on Bishop’s Block, the latest Blackgaard Chronicles novel. Hear how he balances faith, villains, and spy-thriller intrigue—plus a glimpse at what’s ahead in the rest of the series.

If you enjoyed listening to The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast, please give us your feedback.
item.content:encoded:
Phil Lollar dishes on Bishop’s Block, the latest Blackgaard Chronicles novel. Hear how he balances faith, villains, and spy-thriller intrigue—plus a glimpse at what’s ahead in the rest of the series.

If you enjoyed listening to The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast, please give us your feedback.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Odyssey’s Real-Life Working Genius
item.itunes:title: Odyssey’s Real-Life Working Genius
item.description:
Jesse Kellum IV doesn’t just write for Odyssey—he also works at the real-life Whit’s End! Hear how a workplace personality quiz inspired his latest episode, how a slide thermometer sparked a memorable story, and how he tackled the tricky dynamics between Jay and his dad in “Put to the Test.”

If you enjoyed listening to The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast, please give us your feedback.
item.content:encoded:
Jesse Kellum IV doesn’t just write for Odyssey—he also works at the real-life Whit’s End! Hear how a workplace personality quiz inspired his latest episode, how a slide thermometer sparked a memorable story, and how he tackled the tricky dynamics between Jay and his dad in “Put to the Test.”

If you enjoyed listening to The Official Adventures in Odyssey Podcast, please give us your feedback.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: A Very Whittaker Podcast: Totally Random Questions for Andre Stojka
item.itunes:title: A Very Whittaker Podcast: Totally Random Questions for Andre Stojka
item.description: Andre Stojka (voice of Mr. Whittaker) reveals his hobbies, his favorite quote, his least favorite chore, and his most unusual possession. Plus, vote in the Avery Awards and nominate a real-life Whit in your life.
item.content:encoded: Andre Stojka (voice of Mr. Whittaker) reveals his hobbies, his favorite quote, his least favorite chore, and his most unusual possession. Plus, vote in the Avery Awards and nominate a real-life Whit in your life.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Wayback Wednesday: From Stand-Up to Whit’s End with Ed Washington
item.itunes:title: Wayback Wednesday: From Stand-Up to Whit’s End with Ed Washington
item.description: Mark Christopher Lawrence revisits his journey as Ed Washington — from landing the role to bringing humor, heart, and faith to one of Odyssey’s most beloved dads. Hear reflections on his personal faith and how he continues to encounter Odyssey fans. Plus: Check out a brand-new Washington family comic adventure!
item.content:encoded: Mark Christopher Lawrence revisits his journey as Ed Washington — from landing the role to bringing humor, heart, and faith to one of Odyssey’s most beloved dads. Hear reflections on his personal faith and how he continues to encounter Odyssey fans. Plus: Check out a brand-new Washington family comic adventure!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Sisters On and Off the Mic: Katie and Shona Preview Album 79
item.itunes:title: Sisters On and Off the Mic: Katie and Shona Preview Album 79
item.description: Katie Leigh (Connie) and Shona Rodman (Jules) preview Album 79: Eleventh Hour. They share what it’s like playing sisters, how they keep their characters fresh, and how they prepare for recordings. Get a sneak peek at the heart, humor, and surprises ahead—without any spoilers!
item.content:encoded: Katie Leigh (Connie) and Shona Rodman (Jules) preview Album 79: Eleventh Hour. They share what it’s like playing sisters, how they keep their characters fresh, and how they prepare for recordings. Get a sneak peek at the heart, humor, and surprises ahead—without any spoilers!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: From “At Face Value” to the “Eleventh Hour”: What’s Behind and What’s Ahead
item.itunes:title: From “At Face Value” to the “Eleventh Hour”: What’s Behind and What’s Ahead
item.description: Showrunner Marshal Younger, co-creator Phil Lollar, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, and line producer Nathan Hoobler return to answer your questions. Why were the names of the early albums changed? Will marshmallow and pear ice cream ever be available? Is Kandy becoming a regular character? Will we hear from Marla, Chase, Lexi, or Micah again? Will Jason and Jillian appear in the next album? These answers and more—straight from the writing team.
item.content:encoded: Showrunner Marshal Younger, co-creator Phil Lollar, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, and line producer Nathan Hoobler return to answer your questions. Why were the names of the early albums changed? Will marshmallow and pear ice cream ever be available? Is Kandy becoming a regular character? Will we hear from Marla, Chase, Lexi, or Micah again? Will Jason and Jillian appear in the next album? These answers and more—straight from the writing team.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Mapping the Perkins Family Story Arc
item.itunes:title: Mapping the Perkins Family Story Arc
item.description: Showrunner Marshal Younger unpacks the five-episode journey that transformed the Perkins family. How did real-life experiences shape Ron’s path? And why is Bridget’s story still unfinished? Plus: a preview of “The Picture Day Plot”!
item.content:encoded: Showrunner Marshal Younger unpacks the five-episode journey that transformed the Perkins family. How did real-life experiences shape Ron’s path? And why is Bridget’s story still unfinished? Plus: a preview of “The Picture Day Plot”!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Finding Ron Perkins
item.itunes:title: Finding Ron Perkins
item.description: Before voicing Ron, Eric Martsolf was singing at theme parks, performing on cruise ships, and even touring with Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat. Eric shares how his eclectic career prepared him to play a Marine returning home — and what he’s learned from Ron’s emotional journey.
item.content:encoded: Before voicing Ron, Eric Martsolf was singing at theme parks, performing on cruise ships, and even touring with Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat. Eric shares how his eclectic career prepared him to play a Marine returning home — and what he’s learned from Ron’s emotional journey.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Totally Random Edition with Chris Anthony Landsdowne
item.itunes:title: Totally Random Edition with Chris Anthony Landsdowne
item.description: Fans submitted thousands of off-the-wall, anything-goes questions, and Chris is ready to answer. From her favorite childhood book to the one food she’d eat forever, get to know the voice of Adventures in Odyssey like never before.
item.content:encoded: Fans submitted thousands of off-the-wall, anything-goes questions, and Chris is ready to answer. From her favorite childhood book to the one food she’d eat forever, get to know the voice of Adventures in Odyssey like never before.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Buck, Baltimore, and Batting Cages: Exploring “Better Buck Next Time”
item.itunes:title: Buck, Baltimore, and Batting Cages: Exploring “Better Buck Next Time”
item.description: Writer/director Kathy Buchanan and sound designers Luke Guenot and Zach Schneider dive into the making of “Better Buck Next Time.” Hear how Buck’s story evolved after his breakup with Jules, how football and faith collide in this three-parter, and why the team recorded at a real-life batting cage to get just the right sound.
item.content:encoded: Writer/director Kathy Buchanan and sound designers Luke Guenot and Zach Schneider dive into the making of “Better Buck Next Time.” Hear how Buck’s story evolved after his breakup with Jules, how football and faith collide in this three-parter, and why the team recorded at a real-life batting cage to get just the right sound.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Morrie’s Next Move: Atticus Shaffer and Phil Lollar on “Kris-Crossed”
item.itunes:title: Morrie’s Next Move: Atticus Shaffer and Phil Lollar on “Kris-Crossed”
item.description: Morrie Rydell is changing from manipulative villain to surprising hero. Actor Atticus Shaffer and writer/director Phil Lollar take us inside “Kris-Crossed,” discussing Morrie’s changes, behind-the-scenes stories, and insight into the Christian underpinnings of the character. Plus, hear a preview of “Better Buck Next Time, Part 2!”
item.content:encoded: Morrie Rydell is changing from manipulative villain to surprising hero. Actor Atticus Shaffer and writer/director Phil Lollar take us inside “Kris-Crossed,” discussing Morrie’s changes, behind-the-scenes stories, and insight into the Christian underpinnings of the character. Plus, hear a preview of “Better Buck Next Time, Part 2!”
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Bringing Military Authenticity to Odyssey: A Marine’s Story
item.itunes:title: Bringing Military Authenticity to Odyssey: A Marine’s Story
item.description: Marine Josh Hosler shares how his real-life experiences shaped the Adventures in Odyssey episode “Ambush” and more. From military communication to a surprising sheep encounter, hear how he brought authenticity to the story of Ron Perkins—and even landed multiple speaking roles.
item.content:encoded: Marine Josh Hosler shares how his real-life experiences shaped the Adventures in Odyssey episode “Ambush” and more. From military communication to a surprising sheep encounter, hear how he brought authenticity to the story of Ron Perkins—and even landed multiple speaking roles.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Taking Adventures in Odyssey to the next level
item.itunes:title: Taking Adventures in Odyssey to the next level
item.description: We’re saying goodbye to CDs in the spring of 2026 and going fully digital. That means longer storylines for your favorite characters. Less waiting between multi-part stories. More flexibility for fun, one-off episodes. But what about downloads? Will there still be 24 new episodes a year? Executive producer Dave Arnold and showrunner Marshal Younger join producer Bob Smithouser to answer questions about the transition.
item.content:encoded: We’re saying goodbye to CDs in the spring of 2026 and going fully digital. That means longer storylines for your favorite characters. Less waiting between multi-part stories. More flexibility for fun, one-off episodes. But what about downloads? Will there still be 24 new episodes a year? Executive producer Dave Arnold and showrunner Marshal Younger join producer Bob Smithouser to answer questions about the transition.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Totally Random Edition
item.itunes:title: Totally Random Edition
item.description: It’s Opposite Day as hosts become guests and Bob and Jesse tackle more than a dozen TRQs from our listeners!
item.content:encoded: It’s Opposite Day as hosts become guests and Bob and Jesse tackle more than a dozen TRQs from our listeners!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Building “School of Hard Knocks”: Friendship, Sound Design, and New Faces
item.itunes:title: Building “School of Hard Knocks”: Friendship, Sound Design, and New Faces
item.description: Writer Evan David and sound designer Zach Schneider reveal how they brought “School of Hard Knocks” to life. Evan shares the challenge of transforming Clubhouse Magazine’s Tori Mori into an Odyssey character and weaving her into Olivia and Zoe’s storylines. Meanwhile, Zach pulls back the curtain on crafting the polished, dynamic sound of Mapleton Prep.
item.content:encoded: Writer Evan David and sound designer Zach Schneider reveal how they brought “School of Hard Knocks” to life. Evan shares the challenge of transforming Clubhouse Magazine’s Tori Mori into an Odyssey character and weaving her into Olivia and Zoe’s storylines. Meanwhile, Zach pulls back the curtain on crafting the polished, dynamic sound of Mapleton Prep.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Why did Buck and Jules break up? Will Jules stay in the band? Where is the live show in the timeline?
item.itunes:title: Why did Buck and Jules break up? Will Jules stay in the band? Where is the live show in the timeline?
item.description: Showrunner Marshal Younger, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, writer/director Phil Lollar, and line producer Nathan Hoobler answer your  questions about Adventures in Odyssey past, present and future! From Bridget’s job changes and Wyatt’s new voice to hints about Album 78 and beyond, the team answers your most curious inquiries about Odyssey’s past, present, and future. Plus: Learn the titles of Album 78 and 79.
item.content:encoded: Showrunner Marshal Younger, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, writer/director Phil Lollar, and line producer Nathan Hoobler answer your  questions about Adventures in Odyssey past, present and future! From Bridget’s job changes and Wyatt’s new voice to hints about Album 78 and beyond, the team answers your most curious inquiries about Odyssey’s past, present, and future. Plus: Learn the titles of Album 78 and 79.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Rocking Manic Ravioli: The Sound of Jules’s Band
item.itunes:title: Rocking Manic Ravioli: The Sound of Jules’s Band
item.description: Sound designer Nathan Jones and composer John Campbell reveal how they turned “The Itsy Bitsy Spider” into a rock anthem, balanced professionalism with a touch of amateur fun, and tackled the challenges of bringing a fictional band to life.
item.content:encoded: Sound designer Nathan Jones and composer John Campbell reveal how they turned “The Itsy Bitsy Spider” into a rock anthem, balanced professionalism with a touch of amateur fun, and tackled the challenges of bringing a fictional band to life.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Voicing and Writing "Express Salvation"
item.itunes:title: Voicing and Writing "Express Salvation"
item.description: Dive into the making of the latest story arc with showrunner Marshal Younger and actor Dawson Griffin, the new voice of Wyatt Perkins. Why has this story been five years in the making? How did Dawson’s journey to Odyssey begin? What’s coming up for the Perkins family in the days ahead? Find out!
item.content:encoded: Dive into the making of the latest story arc with showrunner Marshal Younger and actor Dawson Griffin, the new voice of Wyatt Perkins. Why has this story been five years in the making? How did Dawson’s journey to Odyssey begin? What’s coming up for the Perkins family in the days ahead? Find out!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: From Odyssey to Hollywood and back again
item.itunes:title: From Odyssey to Hollywood and back again
item.description: Writer Charlie Richards returns to Adventures in Odyssey after 24 years. Discover how his journey from Focus on the Family to a Hollywood sitcom to “The Pond” led to the latest Club adventure, “You Dirty Rat.” Plus hear a preview of the final episodes of Album 77!
item.content:encoded: Writer Charlie Richards returns to Adventures in Odyssey after 24 years. Discover how his journey from Focus on the Family to a Hollywood sitcom to “The Pond” led to the latest Club adventure, “You Dirty Rat.” Plus hear a preview of the final episodes of Album 77!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Celebrating Whits everywhere with Award Winner Richard Moore
item.itunes:title: Celebrating Whits everywhere with Award Winner Richard Moore
item.description: Bob and Jesse celebrate Richard Moore, this year’s Whit Award winner, with his son Chris and grandson Campbell, who nominated him! Hear how Richard’s mentorship was impacted by Whit himself and how his own mentorship has impacted others. Plus, get the latest on new Adventures in Odyssey merch and a preview of the next episode from Album 77!
item.content:encoded: Bob and Jesse celebrate Richard Moore, this year’s Whit Award winner, with his son Chris and grandson Campbell, who nominated him! Hear how Richard’s mentorship was impacted by Whit himself and how his own mentorship has impacted others. Plus, get the latest on new Adventures in Odyssey merch and a preview of the next episode from Album 77!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The Avery Awards 2024, courtesy of AI-Oh
item.itunes:title: The Avery Awards 2024, courtesy of AI-Oh
item.description: All the ideas for the Avery Awards have been done until Bob and Jesse employ their new digital assistant AI-Oh. From daring escapes to singing in spooky mansions, our hosts reveal the fan-voted winners from Album 75: “The Best is Yet to Come” and Album 76: “Keep it Together.”
item.content:encoded: All the ideas for the Avery Awards have been done until Bob and Jesse employ their new digital assistant AI-Oh. From daring escapes to singing in spooky mansions, our hosts reveal the fan-voted winners from Album 75: “The Best is Yet to Come” and Album 76: “Keep it Together.”
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: From England to Odyssey: The Voice Behind Renee D. Carter
item.itunes:title: From England to Odyssey: The Voice Behind Renee D. Carter
item.description: Caitlin Thorburn, the voice of Renee D. Carter, shares her journey from old England to New England (and back again!), mastering Renee's Scottish accent, and what fans can expect from “The Heavens Declare.”
item.content:encoded: Caitlin Thorburn, the voice of Renee D. Carter, shares her journey from old England to New England (and back again!), mastering Renee's Scottish accent, and what fans can expect from “The Heavens Declare.”
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: An update with Andre Stojka
item.itunes:title: An update with Andre Stojka
item.description: Andre Stojka had to miss One Grand Party and had a lot of people praying for him. He gives us an in-depth update on what happened and how he’s feeling now.
item.content:encoded: Andre Stojka had to miss One Grand Party and had a lot of people praying for him. He gives us an in-depth update on what happened and how he’s feeling now.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: FREE EPISODE: “500” (plus bonus interviews!)
item.itunes:title: FREE EPISODE: “500” (plus bonus interviews!)
item.description: Relive the milestone that is halfway to 1000 as you join the folks in Odyssey for a fun behind-the-scenes look. Exclusive interviews, bloopers, a fun-filled tour of our first 500 episodes, and much more!
item.content:encoded: Relive the milestone that is halfway to 1000 as you join the folks in Odyssey for a fun behind-the-scenes look. Exclusive interviews, bloopers, a fun-filled tour of our first 500 episodes, and much more!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Rewind from 1000 to 0001 with Steve Harris and Phil Lollar
item.itunes:title: Rewind from 1000 to 0001 with Steve Harris and Phil Lollar
item.description: Odyssey co-creators Phil Lollar and Steve Harris talk about the creation of Odyssey in 1986 and God’s hand on the show (Plus: We reveal the name of episode #1000!)
item.content:encoded: Odyssey co-creators Phil Lollar and Steve Harris talk about the creation of Odyssey in 1986 and God’s hand on the show (Plus: We reveal the name of episode #1000!)
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Focus president Jim Daly on 1000 episodes
item.itunes:title: Focus president Jim Daly on 1000 episodes
item.description: Focus on the Family President Jim Daly travels the halls of the United States Congress, university campuses, and the State Department and finds Adventures in Odyssey fans everywhere he goes.
item.content:encoded: Focus on the Family President Jim Daly travels the halls of the United States Congress, university campuses, and the State Department and finds Adventures in Odyssey fans everywhere he goes.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: New notes about the first Odyssey theme song
item.itunes:title: New notes about the first Odyssey theme song
item.description: Composer Martie Echito worked on the very first Adventures in Odyssey theme song in 1987 and created the background music for dozens of episodes.
item.content:encoded: Composer Martie Echito worked on the very first Adventures in Odyssey theme song in 1987 and created the background music for dozens of episodes.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Who is Molly's dad? When will Seymore be back? What's going to happen in Album 77?
item.itunes:title: Who is Molly's dad? When will Seymore be back? What's going to happen in Album 77?
item.description: Showrunner Marshal Younger, co-creator Phil Lollar, and line producer Nathan Hoobler answer your questions about Album 76: Keep it Together, future books and episodes, and look forward to Album 77.
item.content:encoded: Showrunner Marshal Younger, co-creator Phil Lollar, and line producer Nathan Hoobler answer your questions about Album 76: Keep it Together, future books and episodes, and look forward to Album 77.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Who played six different parts in “Running the Race”?
item.itunes:title: Who played six different parts in “Running the Race”?
item.description: In the Eric Liddell three-parter, Greg Jbara plays a Headmaster at a school in England, a Scottish track coach, a Manchester reporter, a Japanese officer, an elderly man at a concentration camp…and of course Pastor Wilson! Plus, he’ll be joining us for One Grand Party in Colorado Springs. Greg talks about all of this and more.
item.content:encoded: In the Eric Liddell three-parter, Greg Jbara plays a Headmaster at a school in England, a Scottish track coach, a Manchester reporter, a Japanese officer, an elderly man at a concentration camp…and of course Pastor Wilson! Plus, he’ll be joining us for One Grand Party in Colorado Springs. Greg talks about all of this and more.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Why and how did Buck fall down the stairs?
item.itunes:title: Why and how did Buck fall down the stairs?
item.description: Writer/director Kathy Buchanan and sound designer Zach Schneider discuss Buck’s first (but not last!) adventure in Baltimore – “Making an Honest Buck.”
item.content:encoded: Writer/director Kathy Buchanan and sound designer Zach Schneider discuss Buck’s first (but not last!) adventure in Baltimore – “Making an Honest Buck.”
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Unpack all three parts of “The Rydell Realizations”
item.itunes:title: Unpack all three parts of “The Rydell Realizations”
item.description: “The Rydell Realizations” is a turning point for Emily and especially for Morrie. Get into the spoiler-y details of the story and production with writer/director Phil Lollar and sound designer Luke Guento … but only after you’ve heard all three parts!
item.content:encoded: “The Rydell Realizations” is a turning point for Emily and especially for Morrie. Get into the spoiler-y details of the story and production with writer/director Phil Lollar and sound designer Luke Guento … but only after you’ve heard all three parts!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The five-year journey to “Running the Race”
item.itunes:title: The five-year journey to “Running the Race”
item.description: Executive producer Dave Arnold starting outlining a story about Eric Liddell in 2019 — but the episode wasn’t written and directed by Phil Lollar until 2023 and not released until 2024. Follow the marathon production of the three-part epic. (Plus: A preview of “The Rydell Realizations, Part 3”)
item.content:encoded: Executive producer Dave Arnold starting outlining a story about Eric Liddell in 2019 — but the episode wasn’t written and directed by Phil Lollar until 2023 and not released until 2024. Follow the marathon production of the three-part epic. (Plus: A preview of “The Rydell Realizations, Part 3”)
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The epic production of “Running the Race”
item.itunes:title: The epic production of “Running the Race”
item.description: Sound designer Nathan Jones looks back on all the jogging and Olympic sprints in the first two parts of “Running the Race,” previews the final episode in a prison camp…and tells us the one thing he would save from his home.
item.content:encoded: Sound designer Nathan Jones looks back on all the jogging and Olympic sprints in the first two parts of “Running the Race,” previews the final episode in a prison camp…and tells us the one thing he would save from his home.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The Chairman emerges from the shadows
item.itunes:title: The Chairman emerges from the shadows
item.description: Brian Cummings has played dozens of Odyssey characters from Christopher Columbus to the local soccer coach to Emperor Nero to even Jesus Christ.
item.content:encoded: Brian Cummings has played dozens of Odyssey characters from Christopher Columbus to the local soccer coach to Emperor Nero to even Jesus Christ.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Bridget runs the race and hits the right notes
item.itunes:title: Bridget runs the race and hits the right notes
item.description: Actress Keely Marshal looks back at (spoiler!) singing in “Right Notes, Wrong Key” and ahead to the three-part “Running the Race.”
item.content:encoded: Actress Keely Marshal looks back at (spoiler!) singing in “Right Notes, Wrong Key” and ahead to the three-part “Running the Race.”
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Stories about Will Ryan from his wife Nancy
item.itunes:title: Stories about Will Ryan from his wife Nancy
item.description: In our final podcast looking back at the life of Will Ryan and the creation of “The Best is Yet to Come,” Will’s wife Nancy Niparko Ryan shares stories from their time together, Will’s similarity to Eugene, and the reach of Adventures in Odyssey.
item.content:encoded: In our final podcast looking back at the life of Will Ryan and the creation of “The Best is Yet to Come,” Will’s wife Nancy Niparko Ryan shares stories from their time together, Will’s similarity to Eugene, and the reach of Adventures in Odyssey.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Who is Molly's mom?
item.itunes:title: Who is Molly's mom?
item.description: Dana Powers, voice of Molly’s curiously unnamed mom, remembers auditioning, talks about voicing KitKat commercials, and shares why “One Last Treasure Hunt” is her favorite episode.
item.content:encoded: Dana Powers, voice of Molly’s curiously unnamed mom, remembers auditioning, talks about voicing KitKat commercials, and shares why “One Last Treasure Hunt” is her favorite episode.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Eugene’s voice came from war-torn Ukraine
item.itunes:title: Eugene’s voice came from war-torn Ukraine
item.description: Vitalii Knya, Head of Delivery at Respeecher, tells us how they created Eugene’s line for “The Best is Yet to Come,” the technology behind their company, and what’s going on in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: Vitalii Knya, Head of Delivery at Respeecher, tells us how they created Eugene’s line for “The Best is Yet to Come,” the technology behind their company, and what’s going on in Ukraine.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Join us to celebrate One Grand Party in Colorado Springs!
item.itunes:title: Join us to celebrate One Grand Party in Colorado Springs!
item.description: Calling all Odyssey fans! The 1,000th episode airs this year! We’re inviting fans from all over the country to join us at One Grand Party on August 2-3, 2024, in Colorado Springs. Tickets go on sale on Thursday, January 11. Get more details on today's podcast.
item.content:encoded: Calling all Odyssey fans! The 1,000th episode airs this year! We’re inviting fans from all over the country to join us at One Grand Party on August 2-3, 2024, in Colorado Springs. Tickets go on sale on Thursday, January 11. Get more details on today's podcast.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: FREE AUDIOBOOK: "Showdown with the Shepherd"
item.itunes:title: FREE AUDIOBOOK: "Showdown with the Shepherd"
item.description: As a special gift, hear an entire Imagination Station audiobook! More are available in the Adventures in Odyssey Club. In this adventure, Cousins Patrick and Beth go to the Holy Land in the tenth century BC. Troubles await them as soon as they step out of the Imagination Station. First they meet an angry bear and later an angry giant. Set against the backdrop of the David and Goliath story, the cousins learn that having a giant faith is more important than having a giant on your side.
item.content:encoded: As a special gift, hear an entire Imagination Station audiobook! More are available in the Adventures in Odyssey Club. In this adventure, Cousins Patrick and Beth go to the Holy Land in the tenth century BC. Troubles await them as soon as they step out of the Imagination Station. First they meet an angry bear and later an angry giant. Set against the backdrop of the David and Goliath story, the cousins learn that having a giant faith is more important than having a giant on your side.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: All your questions about "The Best is Yet to Come" answered
item.itunes:title: All your questions about "The Best is Yet to Come" answered
item.description: Why not let Eugene stay in Odyssey? Are you going to use the same technology to bring back old characters? Where did you get Bernard’s lines? Why did the whole family Meltsner family move? Why didn’t we hear Wooton in Eugene’s goodbye party?Are we going to get any episodes with the Meltsners in Baltimore? And most importantly, how old are all of the kids in Odyssey?! Executive producer Dave Arnold, showrunner Marshal Younger, writer/director Phil Lollar, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, and line producer Nathan Hoobler answer the biggest questions about Eugene’s departure.
item.content:encoded: Why not let Eugene stay in Odyssey? Are you going to use the same technology to bring back old characters? Where did you get Bernard’s lines? Why did the whole family Meltsner family move? Why didn’t we hear Wooton in Eugene’s goodbye party?Are we going to get any episodes with the Meltsners in Baltimore? And most importantly, how old are all of the kids in Odyssey?! Executive producer Dave Arnold, showrunner Marshal Younger, writer/director Phil Lollar, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, and line producer Nathan Hoobler answer the biggest questions about Eugene’s departure.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Producing a milestone: “The Best is Yet to Come”
item.itunes:title: Producing a milestone: “The Best is Yet to Come”
item.description: Sound designers Luke Guenot and Zach Schneider talk about working on such a significant series of episodes and how it was the most collaborative production in Odyssey history
item.content:encoded: Sound designers Luke Guenot and Zach Schneider talk about working on such a significant series of episodes and how it was the most collaborative production in Odyssey history
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Katie Leigh on “The Best is Yet to Come”
item.itunes:title: Katie Leigh on “The Best is Yet to Come”
item.description: Katie Leigh, voice of Connie, remembers the recording sessions for the Meltsner four-parter and working with Townsend Coleman as Eugene
item.content:encoded: Katie Leigh, voice of Connie, remembers the recording sessions for the Meltsner four-parter and working with Townsend Coleman as Eugene
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: What do the latest episodes in Album 75 and this month’s Club adventure have in common?
item.itunes:title: What do the latest episodes in Album 75 and this month’s Club adventure have in common?
item.description: Writing discipline, bringing back Dr. Trask, and choosing characters who scare her are all topics on writer Abigail Geiger’s mind.
item.content:encoded: Writing discipline, bringing back Dr. Trask, and choosing characters who scare her are all topics on writer Abigail Geiger’s mind.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Penny and Kimmy remember their past
item.itunes:title: Penny and Kimmy remember their past
item.description: In "As Far As It Depends on Me," both Penny Bassett and actress Kimmy Robertson dealt with emotions and memories from their pasts. Kimmy shares how she conveyed the range of feelings in the story, how she practiced her comedic timing, and the lessons she took from the episode.
item.content:encoded: In "As Far As It Depends on Me," both Penny Bassett and actress Kimmy Robertson dealt with emotions and memories from their pasts. Kimmy shares how she conveyed the range of feelings in the story, how she practiced her comedic timing, and the lessons she took from the episode.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Odyssey Strikes Again! An episode sequel
item.itunes:title: Odyssey Strikes Again! An episode sequel
item.description: In “A Day in the Life,” Hollywood came to Odyssey to make a movie about the town. Writer Evan David tells why this episode from 1991 gets a sequel in the October Club adventure “Extended Cut.” Plus: Hear a deleted scene with Connie and Eugene on the phone.
item.content:encoded: In “A Day in the Life,” Hollywood came to Odyssey to make a movie about the town. Writer Evan David tells why this episode from 1991 gets a sequel in the October Club adventure “Extended Cut.” Plus: Hear a deleted scene with Connie and Eugene on the phone.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The 2023 Avery Awards: Trapped in Jesse’s New Mansion
item.itunes:title: The 2023 Avery Awards: Trapped in Jesse’s New Mansion
item.description: Buckle up - in more ways than one! It's time for the Album 73 and 74 Avery Award, where the winners of Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Sound Design, Best Script, Best Scene, and Best Episode will be finally and dramatically revealed. Journey through the many rooms of Jesse’s new house as Bob announces all of the Avery Awards, with cameos from many Odyssey cast and crew members. It’s going to be a bumpy ride.
item.content:encoded: Buckle up - in more ways than one! It's time for the Album 73 and 74 Avery Award, where the winners of Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Sound Design, Best Script, Best Scene, and Best Episode will be finally and dramatically revealed. Journey through the many rooms of Jesse’s new house as Bob announces all of the Avery Awards, with cameos from many Odyssey cast and crew members. It’s going to be a bumpy ride.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: 2023's Whit Award Winner
item.itunes:title: 2023's Whit Award Winner
item.description: Multiple generations of Odyssey listeners connect as this year’s Whit Award Winner Alaina and her nominator Emma share how mentors affect kids - and how kids affect mentors!
item.content:encoded: Multiple generations of Odyssey listeners connect as this year’s Whit Award Winner Alaina and her nominator Emma share how mentors affect kids - and how kids affect mentors!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The incredible journey of "Precious Lord"
item.itunes:title: The incredible journey of "Precious Lord"
item.description: God took the real Thomas Dorsey on quite the journey to the composition of “Precious Lord, Take My Hand.” For sound designer Nathan Jones and singer Jamal Sarikoki, the production of the audio dramas felt almost as epic.
item.content:encoded: God took the real Thomas Dorsey on quite the journey to the composition of “Precious Lord, Take My Hand.” For sound designer Nathan Jones and singer Jamal Sarikoki, the production of the audio dramas felt almost as epic.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: How did Whit become Whit?
item.itunes:title: How did Whit become Whit?
item.description: With the release of "Young Whit and the Phantasmic Confabulator" and "Young Whit and the Cloth of Contention," the series is complete. Hear from authors Dave Arnold and Phil Lollar about the story of what shaped John Avery Whittaker as a boy.
item.content:encoded: With the release of "Young Whit and the Phantasmic Confabulator" and "Young Whit and the Cloth of Contention," the series is complete. Hear from authors Dave Arnold and Phil Lollar about the story of what shaped John Avery Whittaker as a boy.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Meet Thomas Dorsey, the father of gospel music
item.itunes:title: Meet Thomas Dorsey, the father of gospel music
item.description: Thomas Dorsey wrote more than 3000 gospel songs including "Precious Lord." Actor Leilani Barrett, voice of Thomas in this month's Club adventure, said more than 3,000 words while creating the character for "Precious Lord." He shares the joys and challenges of creating a historical figure.
item.content:encoded: Thomas Dorsey wrote more than 3000 gospel songs including "Precious Lord." Actor Leilani Barrett, voice of Thomas in this month's Club adventure, said more than 3,000 words while creating the character for "Precious Lord." He shares the joys and challenges of creating a historical figure.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Honoring the Legacy of Will Ryan and Continuing on with Eugene Meltsner
item.itunes:title: Honoring the Legacy of Will Ryan and Continuing on with Eugene Meltsner
item.description: Executive producer Dave Arnold, showrunner Marshal Younger, and actor Townsend Coleman share about the way forward with Eugene Meltsner after Will Ryan passed away in 2021. Plus, hear from the girls who ran a 5k in Will’s honor.
item.content:encoded: Executive producer Dave Arnold, showrunner Marshal Younger, and actor Townsend Coleman share about the way forward with Eugene Meltsner after Will Ryan passed away in 2021. Plus, hear from the girls who ran a 5k in Will’s honor.

item.itunes:title: Death and life with Gary Locke

item.title: How "Starring Eugene and Connie" became "Featuring Jason and Jillian"
item.itunes:title: How "Starring Eugene and Connie" became "Featuring Jason and Jillian"

item.title: Remembering Earl Boen
item.itunes:title: Remembering Earl Boen
item.description: Actor Earl Boen passed away January 5, 2023. In this vintage interview from 2002, Earl remembers the creation of Odyssey supervillain - the nefarious Dr. Regis Blackgaard - and his twin brother - Shakespearean actor Edwin Blackgaard. Plus, never-before-heard recordings of classic Blackgaard scenes.
item.content:encoded: Actor Earl Boen passed away January 5, 2023. In this vintage interview from 2002, Earl remembers the creation of Odyssey supervillain - the nefarious Dr. Regis Blackgaard - and his twin brother - Shakespearean actor Edwin Blackgaard. Plus, never-before-heard recordings of classic Blackgaard scenes.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Take a Sled Run for Survival!
item.itunes:title: Take a Sled Run for Survival!
item.description: The latest Imagination Station book "Sled Run for Survival" features all sorts of animal action in the snow, including sled dogs, wolves, walruses, and even a polar bear! But the greatest enemy is one so tiny that no one can see it. Author Marianne Hering and editor Vance Fry unpack this and other exciting historical adventures.
item.content:encoded: The latest Imagination Station book "Sled Run for Survival" features all sorts of animal action in the snow, including sled dogs, wolves, walruses, and even a polar bear! But the greatest enemy is one so tiny that no one can see it. Author Marianne Hering and editor Vance Fry unpack this and other exciting historical adventures.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: How Odyssey gets to your ears
item.itunes:title: How Odyssey gets to your ears
item.description: Follow the links in the chain, plot the path on the map, and meet the unsung heroes of Odyssey as we follow an episode from a sound designer's computer to your ears. Along the way we'll meet mastering engineer Rudy Haerr, satellite operator Ray Morgan, media syndication manager Brian Krause, digital support specialist Steve Christakis, and senior marketing director Debbie Smith. Join us!
item.content:encoded: Follow the links in the chain, plot the path on the map, and meet the unsung heroes of Odyssey as we follow an episode from a sound designer's computer to your ears. Along the way we'll meet mastering engineer Rudy Haerr, satellite operator Ray Morgan, media syndication manager Brian Krause, digital support specialist Steve Christakis, and senior marketing director Debbie Smith. Join us!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Meet first time writer Jesse Kellum IV
item.itunes:title: Meet first time writer Jesse Kellum IV
item.description: Jesse Kellum IV grew up listening to Odyssey and now he's writing (and directing!) for the show. Hear the story of how he got to Odyssey, his first show "Legally Wooton," and traveling to California to record.
item.content:encoded: Jesse Kellum IV grew up listening to Odyssey and now he's writing (and directing!) for the show. Hear the story of how he got to Odyssey, his first show "Legally Wooton," and traveling to California to record.

item.title: From Andy Griffith to Adventures in Odyssey via Apollo 13
item.itunes:title: From Andy Griffith to Adventures in Odyssey via Apollo 13
item.description: Actor Clint Howard voices Nick Smouse, Jay's dad, for the second time in this month’s Club adventure: "A Friend in Need." Clint has a lengthy Hollywood résumé that spans nearly sixty years.

item.title: Making a Godly impact sending boxes around the world
item.itunes:title: Making a Godly impact sending boxes around the world

item.title: From knitting in a blizzard to two brothers in Guatemala... the journey of an idea
item.itunes:title: From knitting in a blizzard to two brothers in Guatemala... the journey of an idea
item.description: Writer/director Phil Lollar shares how "Showdown in San Poco" started as a completely different episode in a completely different part of the world. Then sound designer Nathan Jones tells how the sound of motorcycles was created without... motorcycles. (Plus: Emerson Collins talks about this year's Bring Your Bible to School Day!)
item.content:encoded: Writer/director Phil Lollar shares how "Showdown in San Poco" started as a completely different episode in a completely different part of the world. Then sound designer Nathan Jones tells how the sound of motorcycles was created without... motorcycles. (Plus: Emerson Collins talks about this year's Bring Your Bible to School Day!)
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The 2022 Avery Awards: Bob the Bold vs. The League of Diminutive Dialogue!
item.itunes:title: The 2022 Avery Awards: Bob the Bold vs. The League of Diminutive Dialogue!
item.description: It's time for the "Slippery Slope" and "The Long Road Home" Avery Awards! We’ll reveal the Actor, Actress, Sound Design, Script, Scene, Episode, and more that you, the listeners, voted as winners! Also this year, you’ll get a look behind the curtain of the REAL Adventures in Odyssey Headquarters that has long been kept secret from the public. Our hosts Bob and Jesse will be your tour guides. However an accident may just change the course of this episode - and the very names of hosts - forever!
item.content:encoded: It's time for the "Slippery Slope" and "The Long Road Home" Avery Awards! We’ll reveal the Actor, Actress, Sound Design, Script, Scene, Episode, and more that you, the listeners, voted as winners! Also this year, you’ll get a look behind the curtain of the REAL Adventures in Odyssey Headquarters that has long been kept secret from the public. Our hosts Bob and Jesse will be your tour guides. However an accident may just change the course of this episode - and the very names of hosts - forever!
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: How realistic is "The 18-Yard Line"? A real-life football coach tells us.
item.itunes:title: How realistic is "The 18-Yard Line"? A real-life football coach tells us.
item.description: Ivan Chambers has coached football, basketball, baseball, volleyball, track, and more. He tells us about the emotions, the drama, and the lessons behind the scenes of sports stories like "The 18-Yard Line."
item.content:encoded: Ivan Chambers has coached football, basketball, baseball, volleyball, track, and more. He tells us about the emotions, the drama, and the lessons behind the scenes of sports stories like "The 18-Yard Line."
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: The 2022 Whit Award winner (and the person who nominated him!)
item.itunes:title: The 2022 Whit Award winner (and the person who nominated him!)
item.description: Lexie nominated her coach and teacher Andrew Nedimyer for the Whit Award, sharing how he cares for his students, faithfully teaches God's word, and takes the extra time to help any kids who are stuck. Mr. Nedimyer also grew up listening to Odyssey and even dreamed of opening his own version of Whit's End. Hear their stories and learn how to find Godly mentors of your own.
item.content:encoded: Lexie nominated her coach and teacher Andrew Nedimyer for the Whit Award, sharing how he cares for his students, faithfully teaches God's word, and takes the extra time to help any kids who are stuck. Mr. Nedimyer also grew up listening to Odyssey and even dreamed of opening his own version of Whit's End. Hear their stories and learn how to find Godly mentors of your own.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Farewell to Will Ryan
item.itunes:title: Farewell to Will Ryan
item.description: The Adventures in Odyssey cast and crew remembers Will Ryan (the actor behind Eugene Meltsner, Harlow Doyle, and others) who passed away on November 19, 2021. Voices include executive producer Dave Arnold, executive producer Chuck Bolte, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, actor Robby Bruce (voice of Buck), actor Townsend Coleman (voice of Jason), Focus on the Family president Jim Daly, sound designer Mark Drury, actor Jess Harnell (voice of Wooton), Focus on the Family Guest Relations director Diane Ingolia, co-creator Steve Harris, writer/director Nathan Hoobler, sound designer Rob Jorgensen, host Chris Anthony Lansdowne, actor Katie Leigh (voice of Connie), co-creator Phil Lollar, sound designer Bob Luttrell, executive producer Paul McCusker, actor Phil Proctor (voice of Detective Polehaus), actor Shona Rodman (voice of Jules), actor Andre Stojka (voice of Whit), and actor Audrey Wasilewski (voice of Katrina).
item.content:encoded: The Adventures in Odyssey cast and crew remembers Will Ryan (the actor behind Eugene Meltsner, Harlow Doyle, and others) who passed away on November 19, 2021. Voices include executive producer Dave Arnold, executive producer Chuck Bolte, writer/director Kathy Buchanan, actor Robby Bruce (voice of Buck), actor Townsend Coleman (voice of Jason), Focus on the Family president Jim Daly, sound designer Mark Drury, actor Jess Harnell (voice of Wooton), Focus on the Family Guest Relations director Diane Ingolia, co-creator Steve Harris, writer/director Nathan Hoobler, sound designer Rob Jorgensen, host Chris Anthony Lansdowne, actor Katie Leigh (voice of Connie), co-creator Phil Lollar, sound designer Bob Luttrell, executive producer Paul McCusker, actor Phil Proctor (voice of Detective Polehaus), actor Shona Rodman (voice of Jules), actor Andre Stojka (voice of Whit), and actor Audrey Wasilewski (voice of Katrina).
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: You don't have to be a doctor
item.itunes:title: You don't have to be a doctor
item.description: Trey finds that he has something not just to teach but to learn on this month's Club adventure: "Results May Vary." It's not just medical professionals like Dr. Joseph who make connections with Global Health Outreach. Find out more from Trish Burgess and Alicia Trivett.
item.content:encoded: Trey finds that he has something not just to teach but to learn on this month's Club adventure: "Results May Vary." It's not just medical professionals like Dr. Joseph who make connections with Global Health Outreach. Find out more from Trish Burgess and Alicia Trivett.

item.title: Andre Stojka on Whit: "What a great role."
item.itunes:title: Andre Stojka on Whit: "What a great role."
item.description: Andre Stojka recently set a record -- he's played the role of John Avery Whittaker longer than either of his predecessors. Andre looks back on his time as Whit -- and forward to more adventures.
item.content:encoded: Andre Stojka recently set a record -- he's played the role of John Avery Whittaker longer than either of his predecessors. Andre looks back on his time as Whit -- and forward to more adventures.

item.title: SPOILER WARNING: Explore the "As Buck Would Have It" three-parter from idea to playback.
item.itunes:title: SPOILER WARNING: Explore the "As Buck Would Have It" three-parter from idea to playback.
item.description: If you haven’t heard “As Buck Would Have It,” don't listen to this podcast and go hear Album 72. If you have listened, join writer/director Kathy Buchanan and sound designer Luke Guenot to hear how this adventure was created. Note: This podcast includes both touching moments and morgue freezers.
item.content:encoded: If you haven’t heard “As Buck Would Have It,” don't listen to this podcast and go hear Album 72. If you have listened, join writer/director Kathy Buchanan and sound designer Luke Guenot to hear how this adventure was created. Note: This podcast includes both touching moments and morgue freezers.

item.title: FREE EPISODE: "The Letter"
item.itunes:title: FREE EPISODE: "The Letter"
item.description: Before Adventures in Odyssey, there was "Family Portraits," a short series that introduced the world to what was soon to be everyone’s favorite small town. In the episode "The Letter," a teen named Stacey gets into an argument with her father and eventually finds a way to forgive him. This was the first Focus drama featuring Katie Leigh, who would soon play Connie Kendall. Hear "The Letter" and Katie’s memories of the recording.
item.content:encoded: Before Adventures in Odyssey, there was "Family Portraits," a short series that introduced the world to what was soon to be everyone’s favorite small town. In the episode "The Letter," a teen named Stacey gets into an argument with her father and eventually finds a way to forgive him. This was the first Focus drama featuring Katie Leigh, who would soon play Connie Kendall. Hear "The Letter" and Katie’s memories of the recording.
item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family
